Reviews.Title: “Avoid the top floor and hotel if still refurb.”
Reviews.Author: Jeff H
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were given a room on the top floor. Avoid this at all cost as rooms are small and cramped. More suited to one nighters if at all. Lift is tiny and you can just fit two people in. Refurbishments were on going during our stay and caused noise distrubance during the day and covered us and our room with dust. We tried breakfast one morning but sent the cooked food back as it was cold and the overall experience was very poor. All in all I would not recommend this hotel for a stay and advise you call the hotel to confirm that the refrubishments have completed if you do decide to stay here. There was no information about this work on there website.

Reviews.Title: “Avioid the top floor”
Reviews.Author: DonPedroSkien
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as we moved out from our appartment in the 7th in Paris. During our three years long stay, we have searched the 7th for the best hotels. This one has an excellent location close the the National Assembly and was very close to our appartment. We visited the the hotel prior to making a booking and found everything to be satisfactory. The next day we booked a junior suite for four nights, and we checked in the following day. Some of the guest writing reviews here complain about the charming elevator from 1912. These type of elevators are common in the orginal buildings of the same age and is the only posssible way of maing an elevator without chaning the structure. We find them charming and cosy. After checking in, we found ourselves on the top floor in a small room facing the National Assemby. The view was in a small window 1,8 meters above the floor. The celing was at about 2,1 meters. The room was small and without any possible storage. We stayed for one night only. Such rooms such be considered as lofts and sold at moderate prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in our favourite area in paris”
Reviews.Author: treasureParis
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a view of both the rue de bourgonge and the square in front of the National assembly through french doors that opened onto balconies with flower boxes - perfect! The room was a good size and tastefully decorated, the bathroom clean but dated. We have stayed in this part of Paris on another trip and found it to be the perfect location close to St Germain, Musee D'Orsay, Eiffel tower, Rodin Musee, military musee etc. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as there are a number of bolangeries and cafes in the street and nearby. Rollet Pradier across the road from the hotel is a good place to have lunch in their restaurant upstairs. Tante Margerite next door is a very nice restaurant to have dinner. The staff at the hotel were efficient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Mila L
Reviews.Content: Nice, small hotel. Wonderful location. Safe to walk in the dark hours. Good breakfast, and nice stuff. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. The disappointing thing was not having free WI FI, which is today kind of a basic service. But overall, very good experiance

Reviews.Title: “Great central location & great 'hood”
Reviews.Author: KBlanco
Reviews.Content: We've stayed there 3 times and while it's not the Ritz, it's a very high quality hotel in great neighborhood behind the Senate. Very close to Musee D'Orsay and Place de la Concorde. Easy walking to Louvre and St Germain du Pres. Quiet clean and well attended. The breakfast is too expensive but they have coffee in the room. Will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Remains a favourite resting place.”
Reviews.Author: Dubliner21
Reviews.Content: A year ago I wrote that our family had a very long acquaintance with this charming and convenient hotel. We returned last week and were once more delighted with our stay. Just behind the Assemblee Nationale, (Parliament) and within easy walking distance of Musee d'Orsay . Hotel is neat, quiet, free and efficient wi-fi. Helpful staff and for Paris quite reasonably priced. Yes the lift is a tight squeeze even for 2 as we expand, but it is quite historic, and it is inside the building !!! As for nearby Restaurants.....absolutely no shortage. The highly rated Tante Marguerite next door; le violin d'Ingres which is sensational (see my recent review) is within easy walking distance in the rue St Domenique and well worth the effort, and our latest find Le Petit Bordelaise off the rue St Domenique (see my recent review) is less of a walk and a fine restaurant where you can eat and drink well for under 100 euros if you wish, and will experience a warm welcome and farewell from the chef/patron M. Pentecote. Back to the hotel.......you can walk to Place de la Concorde in less than 10 minutes, and the Grand Palais in not much more. and if you don't want breakfast, there is a long established and highly recommended patisserie across the road. Don't think twice......book now

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, newly re-furbed, friendly front desk.”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotter_n_Kid
Reviews.Content: The hotel wasn't far from the RER so a very easy connection to Gare du Nord plus most of the attractions...we walked back from the Eiffel Tower one night which was a welcome 20 mins stroll after a huge dinner! It was in a quiet district in the heart of what I call "Business-Land" ie not many shops, bistros, cafes about, mainly Office/State buildings. The hotel was in excellent condition having been re-furbed lately. Everything seemed new and it was very clean. The room (a standard double) was small but adequate but I have to say I have never slept on such a hard mattress in all my life! Plus the sheets (flat, not fitted) kept on slipping on the polyester mattress cover making for a rather fidgety night as they bunched up underneath whenever we moved. The room had a mini bar fridge, wi-fi, kettle, TV and safe so everything you need, along with a huge double shower. We didn't eat breakfast in so I cannot comment on that. The lady at reception was very very accommodating and eager to help...she booked a restaurant table for us and gave us any info we needed quickly and without fuss. She made us feel very welcome so well done to the front desk…same for the man who did the later shift! I have no complaints about the hotel. Maybe next time though I think I’d like to be a little closer to the action with a good choice of bistro’s etc close by rather than having to walk at least 15 mins or so…but having said that, chances are that hotel would not be in such a quiet area with such sights on the door step! Overall, a central spot in a quiet location that’s clean and new with helpful staff. PS we ate at Le Montparnasse 1900, 59 blvd Montparnasse ….a 5 course set menu for €34 in a wonderful Art Deco dining room…..fab! Really enjoyed that. Oh, and the Sainte Chapelle have live classical concerts on in the evening at the mo so that may be worth investigating. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: Telluride33
Reviews.Content: It's location was terrific being right near all the Big museums!! The service at the hotel was quite good and our room was quite nice(great bed). By the way no need to pack an umbrella you can borrow one of theirs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cdb26197
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal location. The area is very safe and in walking distance to major Parisian attractions. There is a great bistro on the corner and even a market down the street. The staff was helpful and our room was very small but clean and relatively quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Bourgogne et Montana boutique hotel in 7th Arr., Paris is tops”
Reviews.Author: Linda C
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all- location, ambiance, service, queen bed and excellent value. Go to their website to check out the details and get the special internet price which includes continental breakfast. I've been to Paris many times and this hotel is terrific! This is a small boutique hotel on the quiet square of the Assemble Nationale on the Left Bank, across the bridge of the Seine to the Place de la Concorde. Metro nearby, corner bistro (Le Bourbon), walking distance to the Louvre, Orsay, Rodin, Invalides, St. Germaine de Pres and Rue St. Dominique restaurants and the Eiffel Tower. I love the 7th for it's non-touristy, residential feel. Our room, #50, on the fifth floor, was spacious with a queen bed, room safe, private toliet and good sized bath. Averaged around 180E per night for 6 nights. The 1920's caged elevator is priceless- tiny and efficient. The front desk staff helped with dinner reservations, reserving taxis, and speak perfect English. Clientele during our mid-Sept. 6 day visit was primarily European. Note that the Rue Cler area hotels mentioned by Rick Steves have smaller rooms, 3 star rather than 4, the neighborhood is noisier and it's farther by foot to most sites I've mentioned. Love Rick's guides but want a more upscale hotel than he usually recommends. This is it!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location and Great Morning Eats”
Reviews.Author: MrVeegas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect centralized location with smaller, funky rooms but you're in an old hotel in Paris so that's the norm. Staff was super friendly, spoke great English and didn't get arrogant when I tried my French. Breakfast and coffee was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: reiserice
Reviews.Content: as the hotel we booked last time in Paris was full, we choose the Bourgogne et Montana! and we don't regret at all! our impressions are positives: welcoming staff , clean rooms, good breakfast, and a very good place near all touristic places! we want to say Thank You to Grace who made our stay more than pleasant, and we will definetly go back next year! greetings from Germany PS: we had the room number 67 , it was awesome and modern with a great view!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: bellahenderson
Reviews.Content: My husband, 14 year old son and I stayed here a few weeks ago. I found the hotel because it was one of the few Paris hotels that could accommodate 3 people to a room. We stayed in the Junior Suite on the 4th floor and it was perfect. We had two full baths and the room was large. The staff was very friendly and even though getting a taxi was hard during our stay because of the taxi driver strike, we were centrally located to metro. I was so surprised how truly close we were to Assemblie Nationale and to most every Paris site. This was my husband and son's first trip to Paris and it helped my anxiety level knowing that we were so well taken care of. Thank you! I hope to be back in a year on a "girls' trip".

Reviews.Title: “Excellent again,”
Reviews.Author: Snickmcfee
Reviews.Content: For the second year in a row we stayed at this hotel. Again, the staff, room and service were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, helpful staff & comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: BeenThere4352
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here in April 2011. Could not have asked for a more satisfying stay. Our rooms (3 couples, 3 rooms) were delightful. All decorated differently but all had fabric covered walls, big tiled bathrooms and comfy beds. The rooms are not overly large, one was pretty tight, but we all had closet space & safes. There is a tiny but useful elevator, we were on the 4th floor so we used it a lot. Breakfast in the morning room was varied with lots of bread, rolls, yogurt, fresh fruits, cereals & a hot dish of eggs & potatoes. Wait staff was attentive with coffe & tea requests and kept the room spotless. The front desk staff was always ready to share tips and ideas for restaurants & getting around on the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “It's our house in Paris”
Reviews.Author: dona059
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the B&M for several years and always appreciate seeing Grace and Emily (and being greeted by name) when we arrive. We also enjoy seeing the gentlemen who serve us breakfast who are always friendly and accommodating. It would be helpful to have bars of soap in the room rather than the liquid type. We bought some to use in the room. Also apparently there was a problem with my original booking as it seemed like I had reserved two rooms when I only reserved one. I have found it a bit difficult to use the online booking system. Enjoyed our stay and will be excited to see when the renovation is complete!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Marays
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quiet lovely however feels more like a BnB. For the first time in paris, we actually had a kettle in our room and free wifi !! staff were lovely and room was alright :) their elevator is pretty tiny tho so watch out. location is excellent with two metro stations nearby

Reviews.Title: “Our experience here was as bad as it could get. Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: ConsiderLife
Reviews.Content: We arrived with good expectations, as our companion on this trip had stayed here over 15 years successfully. AS soon as we entered we noticed the entire place was under renovations. When you renovate a hotel to such an extent, you should shut it down. The floors were all covered in paper, the walls dirty with construction dust, and 3 out of 6 floors were out of commission. The hallways smelled like mold. There not only were workers in and out all day, but they banged on the wall next to our bed all day! Incredible. At one point, my 82 year old father was stuck in their tiny tiny elevator for 10 minutes because somebody put a piece of furniture in front of the door and he couldn't get out! The staff is also unfriendly and careless. At one point I even got called Monsieur, and I very much am an undeniable Madame! The renovation is ugly... from old world style to Ikea contemporary ugliness. Not worth the price or the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but centrally situated; our family have watched it improve over 50 years !”
Reviews.Author: Dubliner21
Reviews.Content: In a quiet spot on the Left bank, less than 10 minutes from Place de la Concorde and l'Hotel Crillon, this is within easy walking distance of the Musee d'Orsay, and 5 minutes from Metro Assemblee Nationale. Excellent Restaurant next door........Tante Marguerite, and excellent Patissiere and Boulangerie across the road for croissants and pain au raisins instead of rather pricey breakfast in the hotel . Also convenient for the Rue St Domenique and restaurants nearby, e.g. La Clarisse (fish) Free Internet access in lounge. Room 10 rather dull, but good value for this capital city

Reviews.Title: “Glitch at Hotel Bourgogne Montana”
Reviews.Author: ABHIL
Reviews.Content: 2010 Reservation was for Sept. 24,25,26. We had reserved 2 beds. Our Glitch at Hotel Bourgogne Montana, Paris France. We arrived to be told they were sending us to another hotel in the Hotels Maurice Hurand Group. Tired but hopeful we were sent to the wonderful Hotel Madison (143 boulevard Saint-Germain). Hotel Madison was gracious and placed us in an elegant room and charged us 250E the Hotel Bourgogne Montana price. The following day we returned to the Hotel Bourgogne Montana to a one bed room. When I told management that our reservation requested 2 beds. She looked it up and than said "It is only a requestâ€¦if we had it we would give it to you, BUT it is only a request." So the snoring sisters-in-law were a bit close for the next two days. Paris is a great city and this was just part of the adventure. Ann from Illinois

Reviews.Title: “Clean friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: gone2011
Reviews.Content: This is a good 4 star quality hotel. Our room was clean and well appointed. The bathroom was good although the shower was cramped. We found Paris to be a very expensive city in every respect - especially restaurant food. It would be easy to spend 50 euro per person for a very average main meal. Breakfast at the hotel costs 15 euro and is good. I expected to be impressed with the quality and range of cuisine in Pariain restaurants but found everything to be of average quality. Maybe they are just catering for the thousands of tourists? Anyway we had a great time - the Metro is great and it was easy to get around naviagting by iPhone!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Amazing1672
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in this hotel. We had booked the Hotel de Varenne, which is up the street but due to some booking problems in the middle of the high season, when we reached the Varenne, we were told that they had to make a booking for us at this hotel. We were skeptical at first, especially because Hotel de Varenne was very high in the TA ratings and was the reason why we had chosen it. We had no other option but to say yes to moving to the Bourgogne et Montana (the name of the hotel is definitely a mouthful and not very easy to remember) considering the rate that was given to us was the same as at the Varenne. We walked in a little bit uneasy considering we had no clue about the hotel except as were told it was a 4 star. We had stayed in the Varenne for 3 nights previously and so we did have a benchmark to compare right on the same street. We found the Bourgogne et Montana to be much better equipped than the Varenne (they are a 4 star vs. Varenne a 3 star, so that plays a role). The room was bigger, the bathroom was bigger, the amenities offered were more and quite frankly we had a better stay at this place than at the Varenne, which by the 3 star standards in Paris, is pretty decent (that is for another review). We had one issue with the shower not working properly (our mistake, not the hotel's) but they had no problem in sending someone to our room who explained what was wrong with a smile on her face. The breakfast offered was much better than the breakfast we have had at other hotels in Paris. The staff at the front desk was pleasant all through our stay. All in all - I am very surprised at the negative reviews for this hotel. Considering this is in a great location (very central and yet not very crowded) in Paris and we paid an okay amount for the high season - we had a pretty satisfying stay there. I agree that they need to do something about their showers though - no screen or shower curtain which by the way is another thing I have seen in other Paris hotels. Overall I will recommend this place without reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Disappoint”
Reviews.Author: Geebee2
Reviews.Content: Based on some of the negative comments made earlier about this hotel, I almost changed our booking to another property. I am so glad I didn't. The location of the hotel is perfect for those who don't want to be right in the middle of the nightlife or the cafe/restaurant scene but within walking distance of those places. It is also super convenient for so many museums, and of course very close to the river and Place Concorde. We arrived from Australia early in the morning on the 24th April. As expected, our room of course at such an early hour - it was only about 8.30 in the morning - but our luggage was stored and we were shown a lounge where we could freshen up and relax and were advised that our room could be made ready for us by 10.30. That was great news. Of course, Paris waited and so we had a quick freshen up and then walked the short distance down to the river, across the bridge and into the Tuileries to just remind ourselves that we were back in our favourite city. When we returned to the hotel it was probably about 11.00, and our room was ready. We had booked a premier executive, but then found that we had been upgraded to a junior suite. It was lovely. Quiet, comfortable, restful and roomy, with the most superb round stained glass windows - so very Paris. The bed was fantastic. Was there something which we could fault? Oh yes, no shower screen or curtain, and so, as has been mentioned before, the bathroom became rather flooded when you took a shower. That is a pretty minor problem, and one which the hotel can easily overcome. The breakfast, which was included in our excellent advance purchase rate, was great. As well as the usual cereal, yoghurt, pastries, there was bacon and eggs, and the bacon was just delicious. We couldn't fault the breakfast. Members here have commented on the unfriendly staff. We didn't find that to be the case at all. We did find that most of the staff were very professional, and perhaps in a way quite different to staff in Australian or American hotels. Give me an unsmiling professional over a I'm-your-new-best-friend slightly incompetent person anyday. After three nights in the hotel we were heading down to Bordeaux for 10 days, and so we left some of our luggage at the hotel to collect later. This was handled in a professional way, and kept in such a way that it was secure and we had no cause to worry about it, and when we called back to collect it after our trip south we were actually escorted to the luggage room, a little point I found very reassuring. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel, and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location but not much service!”
Reviews.Author: WarmYeti
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel couldn't be better if you want to see the sights in Paris. It is within easy walking distance of Les Invalides, the museums ( the Rodin is just around the corner), the Eiffel Tower and the river taxis on the Seine. RER and metro stops are within 100m so the rest of the city is right there within a few minutes. The Pont d'Alexandre is particularly spectacular at midnight when you have someone you love close by! But be sure to get there before they turn the lights out - and if its freezing cold and snowy hold them tight and enjoy the view! The rooms (especially room 54) are very nice - and quite big for Paris hotels. Some have a curious corridor that leads to them but it makes them very private and quiet and the furnishings are excellent if a bit tired. The bathroom we had did not have a decent shower which was a problem as the water went all over the floor...not good if you have a foot-on-dodgy-floor phobia! Also, and we understand it was v chilly outside, the room was BLOODY FREEZING as the heating didn't work and the hotel staff seemed incapable or uninterested in fixing it. Loads of bugger-off massive radiators but all at close to zero degrees! (Good excuse to snuggle up with aforesaid loved-one*) Altogether a lovely place but depends who you go with - restaurants close-by are limited so be aware. The lift is a Paris special cage that just about fits two people plus a small bag...see * above. Good fun but beware of the tea - we asked for an extra bag or two and the response was, "Are you serieux Monsieur?" Too right we were!!

Reviews.Title: “I stay here frequently for business, at least once a month.”
Reviews.Author: goombie
Reviews.Content: I stay here frequently for business, at least once a month. Some rooms are better than Others and they are currently rennovating the old staircase in the hotel. Some staff great others awful. Breakfast staff devoid of personality and some reception Staff grumpy as hell. BUT....good location, delicious restaurant next door for dinning. For a central Paris hotel price/uality is good. Overall I would recommend it. It's not anywhere As bad as some make out below.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet hotel in a very safe area close to several metro stations”
Reviews.Author: espruytte
Reviews.Content: Very typical Parisian hotel with nice and clean large bedrooms with flat screen TV and mini-bar. Beds are excellent! Excellent FREE WiFi in all rooms and hotel lounge ! It is located near the AssemblÃ©e Nationale (Palais Bourbon) in the 7th Arr. which of course is a safe and quiet neighborhood, especially during the weekend. Just across the Seine from the hotel you reach the Place de la Concorde (5 mins). If you walk 10 mins to the East you reach the famous Saint-Germain-des-PrÃ©s. Three metro stations nearby: Invalides, AssemblÃ©e Nationale & SolfÃ©rino. The breakfast is included in the room rate and offers a good choice of food and drinks. Employees at the reception desk are very friendly! Now the small list of negatives: 1. The very old elevator was out of service (again!) for the whole three days, which is quite annoying when you walk around Paris all day and need to go to your room on the 4th floor. 2. All rooms have a bathtub, NO showers, and I definitely prefer to use showers in hotels. 3. Room noise insulation is not great, which is quite typical in large city hotels. Conclusion: I would definitely recommend this hotel for a weekend break in Paris when you spend most of your time outdoors in the city and get back to your quiet hotel room late at night for a good night of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: razzledooda
Reviews.Content: Overrated and overpriced. Booked due to good reviews on various websites and 3 for 2 nights deal. Even so, the hotel was not worth the fee that was charged. The room was very small and it was almost impossible to be comfortable in the room due to the small size and awkward furniture arrangement. This made the stay rather unpleasant. There was a distinct lack of customer service. When I called reception, it was only after many attempts to call that somebody answered the phone. When the phone was answered, I asked for an extra bathrobe and some more tea for the kettle in the room. I was told that they did not do ''room service'' as if I was asking for room service...Eventually I was asked to go to reception to collect some tea bags. I had never heard of such a thing in any hotel, let alone a supposedly 'good' four star hotel. The single bathrobe was not changed for the 3 nights we stayed and nor were the cotton pads replaced. Breakfast was very average. Not an enjoyable stay and not impressed by the service.

Reviews.Title: “A two star masquerading as a four star...”
Reviews.Author: TelAvivTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Bourgogne et Montana Hotel for almost 10 years. The first time I stayed there, I figured it was a four star hotel masquerading as a three star. It was great! I found the staff welcoming, the services generous, and the breakfast copious. My stay in October will be my last. I am sorry to say the level of service as deteriorated to that of a two star. During the week, my tiny bar of soap was never replaced. Some days I only received one hand towel and often no washcloth. The sheets were never changed during my 4 day stay. The shower head in my room was unusable and despite my request for service, it never changed. Although they advertise that they have air conditioned rooms, my friend's room had no AC during a week when the temperatures rose above 80 degrees. I will be looking for another "favorite" hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant 4 nights stay with a baby”
Reviews.Author: gaviero_prin
Reviews.Content: we got with an special deal by internet. it was our second trip with our baby (10 months) and everything went fine : we had a free room upgrade , the location is perfect for museums and city centre, the breakfast is good and service was very good at all times. the area is not full of night life ( ok for us) but 200 meters away you are already close to Museum Orsay and other more commercial areas

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend this hotel because of the front desk staff.”
Reviews.Author: Dunnlover
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and in a good location for walking to museums. I loved the lift. The staff in the breakfast area was exceptionally friendly. The staff at the front desk (one woman in particular) left a lot to be desired. There was a mix up with my reservation. They were annoyed and not at all interested in viewing the reservation I had printed and brought along. I would not stay here on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not thrilled with this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sydsmom10
Reviews.Content: Paris was the last stop our first trip to Europe. We had been very happy with all of our accomodations in Italy. Hotel Bourgogne et Montana is "off the beaten track" however we were fine with that. Very cute on the outside but very small accomodations. Again, we were fine with that and expected it. We were unhappy with the level of service by staff. In all of our other experiences traveling, hotel staff were always eager and willing to assist. The staff at Hotel Bourgogne seemed "annoyed" with questions and requests for assistance. Not friendly at all..well, until we asked for taxi on our last day. Very disappointed and would not recommend or stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: HoustonDhm
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at Hotel Bourgogne et Montana almost every year since 1994. Each year it seems to get better and better. We love the little Boutique feel of the hotel. The staff is the best! We've come to know most of the them quite well. They always make us feel at home. One year they booked a fantastic dinner cruise down the Seine for us on New Year's Eve! The breakfast is absolutely wonderful. The decor is very inviting and we've seen a lot of beautiful changes in the past year or so. We look forward to our visit again this fall. The Basilique Sainte Clotilde is a block or two behind the hotel and is our church when we are there. We even know the Pastor! The church has a magnificant organ that adds so much to the services. There's a little Mono-Prix behind the hotel where we pick uo our wine and cheese--also several little speciality shops in the area. It's a great neighborhood right behind the National Assembly, which gives you a very safe feeling. And two Metro stops, a Post Office, and the best museums close by. We've been there at Easter,Thanksgiving(and yes, you can get turkey) and New Year's. We go either in the fall or spring and enjoy it evertime.

Reviews.Title: “small comfortable hotel in safe area, convenient for lots of areas...”
Reviews.Author: Anne51
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our silver wedding anniversary. The room, although not large, was comfortable with TV, tea and coffee etc. Bathroom had lovely green tiling (from 30's or 50's??), two basins and good shower in bath (although a bit low down - I was fine as I am only 5' 4"!) Bed, duvet and pillows were very comfortable. The hotel is very near the Assemblee Nationale so full of gendarmes and feels safer for that. We ate at the Brasserie Bourbon a few times - good food and wine and chatty helpful waiters. Not as many eateries in the area but what we found was good. Extremely convenient for the Place de la Concorde, Tuileries, Louvre, musee d'Orsay, Invalides, Eiffel Tower etc. We walked to Latin quarter from here and even to Montmartre! (although it is further and we did need a coffee stop!) Breakfast was quite good although not alot of hot food really. In all we enjoyed our stay - it did seem quite expensive but this is mostly due to the poor euro/pound exchange rate.

Reviews.Title: “mediocre hotel in an inadequate location”
Reviews.Author: theshoemaker
Reviews.Content: Firstly, let me say that I stayed here as the hotel was reserved by an employer, I wouldn't have picked this hotel myself due to a slightly off-the-path location. its seemingly between many major areas of interest, but ended up being a very long walk away from anything. the hotel itself looks nice outside, the small lobby opens to a slightly more modern lounge and a breakfast room. this was as nice as it got though, the receptionist mumbled very little and didn't exactly appear welcoming. The elevator, a box that could just fit two adults WITHOUT suitcases broke during the first day of our stay. with a room on the 6th floor, we had to walk up and down the narrow and uneven staircase. Apparently the ancient elevator would not function for another few weeks. Our room absolutely reeked of some cheesy incense, probably sprayed to cover the musky smell that was noticeable. there was also a scent of cigarettes that might've been coming from the air conditioning. speaking of which, there was no way to turn off the AC nor adjust the speed, which meant that it was blowing at full blast through the vents right above the bed. The room was right next to a maintenance storage, which meant that there was constant noise from early on in the morning. Also, apparently the exterior of the building was being renovated at one side, meaning there were very loud sounds of constructions through out the day. Housekeeping seemed to leave room doors open when cleaning them, so I actually caught a glimpse of several different types of rooms when walking down the stairwell. seems like some were more nice looking where as others looked very washed out. Overall, the only things that made my stay here memorable were the strong odor, endless stairs and loud construction noises. not exactly the most pleasurable stay. There are many nicer hotels in the city at this price level, I don't see a reason to stay here unless you need to spend a considerable amount of time around the Assemblee area.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet stop, great breakfast (included), charming neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: mpc1013
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this hotel during our honeymoon. We arrived well ahead of check-in time, and were not only checked-in early, but upgraded to a top floor room that was quiet roomy by Paris standards. Staff was very helpful in getting us around to see the sites. Breakfast included at this hotel, which was very good and much appreciated. The lift (elevator) unlike any other we've seen. Room was very nice, with excellent bath - rugs could be replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Poor management, poor value”
Reviews.Author: jlet
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for that quaint, charming, pleasant hotel in Paris, the Bourgogne-Montana Hotel is not it. We booked an "executive room" through their website, primarily because we got such a great deal. Well, everyone else evidently booked this special, too, and the managers couldn't seem to keep up with the traffic. When we arrived in the afternoon from the train station, the lobby was full of people, and it took two people behind the desk to attend to one customer (this was true throughout the trip). When we finally got to the desk to check in, a frazzled woman behind the desk greeted us by saying "you should be thankful your room is already cleaned." (!) We were then notified that we had been "upgraded" to a suite on the first floor. The room itself was huge--we even had a extra WC--but the ceilings were really low and there were two tiny windows that looked out onto a courtyard that was above the room, giving the room the feel of a basement apartment (it's room 17, by the way, in case you want to avoid it). When we inquired as to whether there was a room with more windows, even if it meant a smaller space, we were told that "all of the rooms have those windows." So, I can only assume that if you are taller than 6ft or claustrophobic, that no room at this hotel is suitable for you. In a town like Paris, I can accept the fact that rooms are strange. What I had trouble with was that the hotel was so poorly managed. A request for a wake up call was missed the morning of our flight. The concierge assured us she had made reservations at a local bistro, and when we showed up, there was clearly no reservation. The starting price for a room according to a board posted in the lobby, is 200 Euros. For this, you should be able to get a wake up call and a room with sunlight. The breakfast was fine, but the quality of food wasn't what we had been having during our stay in France. (I'll make an exception for the raisin rolls--quite yummy!, but not the lukewarm yogurt). The location is decent and highly walkable to many areas of Paris. You are in a more residential area, so if you are hoping to be steps away from lively cafes and restaurants, you may want to look in the 5th, 6th, 3rd or 4th. But, the cafe by the Assemblies National is a good place for a pre-dinner drink. Also, you are about a 5-min walk from the Assemblies metro and if you walk a few minutes further over the river, you can hit the Concord stop, which has a few more lines. If you need a taxi from your hotel, you are better off walking to a main street. It takes the hotel about 20 minutes to call one for you (so plan ahead if you are going to the train station or airport). If this hotel could be run better, it might be a gem, but given it's location and cave-like rooms, there is no way I would ever recommend this to anyone. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value, good service”
Reviews.Author: TheSmogs
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel largely on the basis of the reviews here and because of a reasonable "buy two nights get one free" deal on Expedia, and we spent 6 days here around Easter at an all-in room only price of GBP712 for an Executive Room. The room itself is an unusual shape, as others have noted, with an area with a desk and tea/coffee facilities before you reach the main bed area. The bed is a standard double (4'6" or 1.50m) and the area is cosy, but has quite a bit of storage. The bathroom is a reasonable size and nicely fitted out (except that the absence of shower screen/curtain, as is the French way, takes some getting used to). It takes a moment to realise that the curtains in the room are for decoration, and that the way to block the light is to lower blinds which are outside the windows. The TV is small, and only had one functioning channel in English (CNN), but then I guess not many people go to Paris to watch TV. We didn't take breakfast so can't comment on that, but we did discover how cheap food and wine is in French supermarkets, so we bought our own supper/breakfast and kept it in the minibar fridge, which had plenty of room. The lift up to the rooms is an amazing old device, and big enough only for two people without luggage or one with, but it seems very safe. The service was very good throughout our stay - my attempts at French were humoured and where comprehension failed all the staff had enough English for us to communicate effectively. There were a couple of minor issues with the room when we checked in (the previous guest had left the safe locked open, and a couple of lights weren't working) but these were all fixed very promptly once we notified the front desk. The room was clean and the servicing was very efficient, and done even when we didn't leave the room until well into the afternoon. They were also happy for us to use their computer at reception to make a couple of booking which required us to print out e-ticktets, and to do our online flight check-in before leaving. They also happily booked a taxi for us. The location of the hotel is excellent in that the Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysees, St Germain, Louvre, and Notre Dame are all within 20-30 minutes walk, although the immediate vicinity of the hotel is very quiet. All in all this is a place that I would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in europe”
Reviews.Author: GingerPryor
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous two room suite with two bathrooms was fantastic for me and my teenage son. The staff were wonderful, the location brilliant - close enough to everything but away from the frenzy of the summer crowds. The local area was pretty much shut down for the summer holidays which was a little disappointing but that's no fault of the hotel. I'll definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaBanner
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel based on the reviews we read on trip advisor and are pleased that we did. The location is fantastic - close to the Eiffel tower, Louvre, Musee d'Orsay etc. It is in a quiet, well kept area (probably as it so close to the National Assembly). Our room was a good size by Parisian standards with a large en-suite (separate loo), very comfy bed with the softest pillows. The air con worked which is a bonus, hotel rooms are often too hot for my liking. The lift is a quirky but not recommended for claustrophobics or people on the larger side of average. Fabulous patisserie opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with character in a great location”
Reviews.Author: LaRoyaute
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights over New Year. The hotel is in a very quiet street but a short walk to the Seine and Musee D'Orsay. The buses and metro are also just a few minutes walk. Our room was small, but well equipped and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave! :(”
Reviews.Author: DaisyRoseTulip
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous about the hotel before arriving. However, we were very happy with it. We arrived by taxi and were met, on the street, by a porter who helped us with our luggage as we dodged the crazy Parisan traffic. Our room was small, but pretty, and despite being there for nearly a week, with a bit of general organisation the size of it did not become an issue. It was also very clean. The issue with of there not being a shower-curtain was not a big deal (best to hold the shower-head). The room was also serviced very nicely each day and, very imporantly, the mini-bar was restocked, with fairly reasonably priced drinks! We booked B&B, however, we missed breakfast every day. Although, the staff did encourage my boyfriend to help himself to the breakfast-buffet and to bring it up to the room while I was getting ready which was a nice touch. The crossants were beautiful. In fact, we found the staff very friendly and helpful. Although, we would recommend that if you indeed to book tickets for anything to do it yourself. We arranged to go to Le Lido, which is definately worth going to, and a bit of confusion resulted. We loved the pretty street on which the hotel is located and had no issues with street-noise. The florists across the street proved to be a lovely view, as did the National Assembly, which was the only reason that we managed to get home every night as taxi-drivers tended not to know the hotel or Rue de Bourgogne. In comparison to Ireland, taxis are very reasonably priced in Paris and we found the hotel to be well situated. On the first night we ate in the restaurant which is located to the left of the hotel as you come out the door. There was a set-menu on that night and we would not recommend it unless you are partial to controversal meat (foie gras and veal). We did not eat three courses of it and it was a bit of a culture-shock to see such controversal meats on a set-menu! As those who have previously travelled to the continent will know, hotels are very different there to ones here and price and standard do not always correlate. However, we did enjoy our stay and are currently planning our next trip to Paris during the Spring.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ali26
Reviews.Content: My huband and I stayed here for 4 nights on a romantic vacation. This hotel was AMAZING!!! Positives: Great location (near National Assembly which was guarded so it made is feel safe haha), quiet cute street, clean modern room and bathroom, windows that opened to look onto the street, good size bathroom with 2 sinks, very friendly/helpful front staff, great continental breakfast with made-to-order cappuccinos, quiet rooms. Negatives: although the bathroom shower was large, it only has a half wall so sometimes water would spray on the floor if you weren't careful. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Paris! Couldn't' have asked for a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: hotelcritic_8
Reviews.Content: This is great hotel in Paris. Christopher was very welcoming;, my bags didn't make a plane transfer in London - he immediately reconfirmed the delivery process with the airline when I checked in and made sure the bags were in the room by the time I returned from dinner! The elevator is a trip, but it works. The lounge and breakfast rooms are beautifully decorated. I booked a deluxe room, but ended up in a jr suite according to the room distibution, which made it a good value for Paris. This is charming old Paris in decor - yet the room had an opening window, was very spacious, had a great desk with TV and mini fridge. Two sinks in bathroom. Complaints are the mattress (awful, had to double up the comforter to get any softness) and the shower (it was great but the entire bathroom floor was soaked as it sprays all over) and that there was a charge to use the computer (I didn't bring my laptop.) However, I would definitely stay there again. It's a good location for walking to the museums and left bank shopping. The Bourbon Brassiere on the corner is excellent, as is the Tante Marguerite Restaurant, right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarah_blay
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the Bourgogne et Montana Hotel for a long weekend (Friday - Tuesday) in May 2008. On arrival, we were greeted by a receptionist who couldn't be more friendly. He gave us all the information we needed about getting around the city as it was our first time in Paris. He provided us with maps and leaflets, and also spoke very good english which was a great help to us. The receptionist then showed us to our room. We used the famous ''birdcage'' lift which dates back to around 1920. The lift was very small, and could only be used by one person + one suitcase, but we thought this added to the charm of the hotel. When we arrived at our room, we had a pleasant suprise to find that we had been upgraded to an executive double room (at no extra cost) Room #14, with king size bed. The room was a nice size for the 2 of us, and very cosy. The duvet and pillows were especially comfy! The hotel itself is in an excellent location, situated behind the assemblee nationale which was guarded by armed police officers - 24/7. This makes the area around the hotel feel very safe. The hotel is within a short walking distance of all the main sights - No need for taxi's or the metro, but there is a metro station very close by if needed to travel further afield. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody stopping in Paris, and we would stay here again if we visit Paris for a second time.

Reviews.Title: “Not what is expected from a four star”
Reviews.Author: vikki0
Reviews.Content: In a very pretty street, close to the Metro and within walking distance of the Place de la Concorde. Not in an obvious tourist area so at weekends a lot of the nearby restaurants and bars are shut. The air-con in the room did not work - which given the temperature outside - made sleeping difficult. As did a very hard mattress. We had a standard room - slightly larger than most because it was in a corner - but still the usual small Parisian room. The bathroom tiles were cracked, there was no shower curtain and the maid did not replace toiletries during the weekend stay. Electrical sockets were hanging off the wall. Despite offering Canal + sports channel on the Tv this was scrambled for much of the weekend. The BBC channel was also scrambled. Overpriced and definitely not what I expect from a four star hotel. Most of the staff were very helpful and breakfast was good. But I was taken aback by the night receptionist who stopped me taking a newspaper from the lounge up to read in my room - it was 10.30pm at night and there were a number of unread copies on the coffee table. He was very rude, only relenting to suggest I bring it back downstairs after I had read it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and authentic!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelerAustin
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend at this hotel, having seen a writeup of it in a book about small deluxe Parisian hotels. Wow this did not disappoint! When we checked in they upgraded us to an executive suite which was huge, with two bedrooms and two full baths! Although the building is obviously old, the facilities in the bedroom were very up to date - nice bathrooms and flat screen TVs. Decor was delightful. The breakfast was included in the rate and was fabulous. The best scrambled eggs I have ever eaten. The location was out of the way but still walkable to most everything; we felt very safe there. I would love to return!!

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: tac1rn
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for the large, ultra deluxe, chain-type hotel, this is not the place for you. However, if you want the charm and personal service of a truly unique boutique hotel, look no futher! The location is fantastic; it's a short walk to many of the major attractions, and close to 3 Metro stations (Assemble Nationale, Invalides, Varenne). We were 3 women traveling together, and felt perfectly safe walking alone, even late at night. (The hotel is directly accross from the Assemble Nationale with armed guards on all sides 24/7.) The staff was exceptionally friendly, and all spoke English. They went out of their way to assist in any way possible. The guest rooms, restaurant, and lobby areas were immaculate! The bird-cage elevator truly is part of the charm and experience. This is an exceptional hotel, and an amazing value for the money. I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Montana hotel”
Reviews.Author: alchu
Reviews.Content: I have to say after looking at some comments from previous people I was in the middle on this hotel. But I can tell I am happy I picked this hotel, the staff are just great they all speak English and are from multi cultural backgrounds. They are very friendly and helpful I never experienced one rud action. The buffet breakfast is more like a brunch/combo it has almost anything you would want set in a cozy breakfast room. We had room 37 which is two room 2 bath suite, great. We loved the birdcage elevator. The hotel is immaculate. The location is great central for a walk or metro ride anywhere, it is also very quiet and safe. I will only stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not four star”
Reviews.Author: garcini
Reviews.Content: The hotel is definitely not four star: no help to carry luggage, an elevator that can barely fit two people, just one person at reception all the time, poor breakfast service and extremely small rooms with barely space to move around (no use asking for the "executive" rooms -- #34, 44, 54 and 64-- as they are more expensive and also very small). But it was clean, which is something. And never, never, purchase a 1-hour internet card: 15 euros!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location and decor”
Reviews.Author: PDom
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd stay at the hotel. All the rooms are different and somehow I got the same "deluxe" room twice (#14). Great location, very quiet and room #14 is very cool ( see pics). Red fabric walls, long entry hallway. High recommend this hotel. Like most Paris hotel, avoid the "standard" room which is usually painfully small.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Intimate - Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RugLord
Reviews.Content: Located in one of the poshest residential neighborhoods in Paris, this small hotel is within walking distance of most of the major shopping and sights. Located on a small plaza behind the Assemblie National, the hotel was comfortable. I recommend, however, getting a junior suite (the best price for the best sized room of many hotels we looked at). And, get one that faces the plaza. Our bedroom was cool and comfortable with dual basins, one bathtub, hand held shower (the "douche"), and a king sized bed. The breakfast, which lasts until 10, was very ample with most anything you need to get your motor fueled for a day of walking. The front desk woman was very unhelpful and cool to us, but warmed up and became helpful as our stay progressed. Just kill her with kindness no matter what you get in return.

Reviews.Title: “Charming parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: gentle2thdr
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this little hotel. It was clean and well decorated with a french feel. The staff were wonderful and helpful. They all spoke english fluently. It was clean and quiet. The location is very central and we walked everywhere from our hotel. There is a metro stop very nearby. Our room was very neat and the bathrooms were very pleasing. The shower heads actually had water pressure and they were wonderful. Closet and drawer space was plentiful. Would definitely book again!

Reviews.Title: “Small Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelWarriors
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good location, a few blocks from bakeries, cafes, shopping. Hotel is directly behind the National Assembly, a few blocks from St Germain Blvd. Across the street from a good bakery, a few blocks from the Muse DOrsay; two/three blocks from the National Assembly Metro; walking distance to the Place de Concord and the Concord Metro. Walking distance to the Hotel Crillion. Small somewhat elegantly/tastfully decorated hotel. Cons: Elevator only holds one person with no luggage; felt somewhat isolated from the action of Paris; room had a view of the roof of the next building; breakfast is very basic and very expensive; staff does not offer to help with anything unless you ask (no help with luggage, etc, even when they are standing a few feet away) Staff seem to be annoyed when asked anything. Overall, I would recommend this hotel because it is very very quiet, safe, very clean, somewhat stylish, room had a lot of classy charm, design and decoration and hotel is well located near several different Metro Stops. However, if you want friendly ,personable or helpful staff, this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 2newtravelers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It is centrally located to many of the sights. We ending up walking everywhere the first 5 days just becuase the sights we wanted to see were so close. It is also situated in a very quiet neighborhood. We did not try the breakfast but instead went to the 2 bakeries a couple of blocks down. It also seemed very safe, since there were guards out for the National Assembly 24 hours a day. The room was small, but we had already expected it. It was very clean. However, the shower/sink area does not have a door to seperate it from the the sleeping area. Nor does the shower have any curtains. I'm not sure if this is true for all the rooms. My only complaint was that the bed was very hard and uncomfortable. We were on the 5th floor facing the street. Not too bad. The elevator is very small, but it kind of adds to the charm. We found the majority of the staff to be quite friendly and helpful. I would consider staying here again becuase of the location but maybe upgrading to the next level in hopes that it has a more comfortable bed. (We were staying in the 180 euro room)

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: WheatStacker
Reviews.Content: My largest complaint is service. The desk clerks ranged from cold to rude. I had to ask for the porter to carry my luggage to my cab and was met with a sigh at the front desk that I would want that service. I returned one evening at 10, and the desk clerk was asleep and seemed annoyed that I had woken him. The breakfast was mediocre at best. The room was comfortable and well appointed, but had no sunlight. This was a suite on the first floor facing what was called a courtyard but gets no light - I was told I was confirmed for a junior suite - larger bedroom and sitting area, not a separate sitting area/second bedroom on the fifth floor. I would never stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel nice location”
Reviews.Author: triptoday
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bourgogne with my family( 3 teens) just before Easter on a 4 day trip to Paris. It is small French style Inn in a very nice part of Paris. We were given 2 side by side rooms on the 3rd floor, rooms 32&34. The rooms were nicely decorated with large updated bathrooms. The beds were very comfortable with good lighting for reading and a LCD television. The property was very clean. The hot breakfast provided in the morning was excellent and the staff spoke good English and were very friendly and accommodating. My only complaint was that the hotel did not use shower curtains( a hygiene thing I was told) so I found taking a shower was not as warm and comfortable as it could have been. The Bourgogne is located in the 7th Arrondisement and is very handy to the Musee Orsay,Eiffel Tower, Invalides and Louvre. The Champs Elysees is 15-20 minutes on foot. There are not a lot of family restaurants nearby but as in all of Paris there are always choices within reasonable walking distance in all directions.

Reviews.Title: “great bistro next door”
Reviews.Author: BostonGoose
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a six night stay at the hotel bourgogne et montana. This is a very well situated hotel for visiting the musee d'orsay or the rodin museum or for shopping on the rue de bac; and it is very quiet(good for getting a good night's sleep). It is in a beautiful neighborhood. However, it is rather expensive. The breakfast,which is included in the price of the room, is of poor quality. We would have rather gone out to a local cafe than eaten at the hotel(which we,in fact, started doing after a couple of days). The rooms were clean; and the beds were comfortable. I would not reccommend a room on the 6th floor, as the ceilings are too low and the windows more like portholes. Service at the front desk was spotty. One concierge forgot to give me a message until I asked if he might check again to see if one was there for us. He then was quite apologetic when discovering that it had been there all along. The absolute best thing about the hotel was the bistro next door: Tante Marguerite!!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fine”
Reviews.Author: GCDOM
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three nights' stay here from 10-12 February. The hotel is in a very smart district near some of the most chic addresses in the city and next to the AssemblÃ©e Nationale - just two minutes walk from several metros. There are numerous good cafes and restaurants nearby, although the one over the road wasn't much to write home about - try the CafÃ© d'Orsay round the corner from the Museum, about 5 minutes walk away. Public areas of the hotel are in very good condition - there's the odd bit of scuffed paintwork but it's hardly going to ruin your stay. The room (250 euros) was of very good size, spotlessly clean and decorated with taste, with a large blue and white tiled bathroom (also spotlessly clean) and more than enough space for two people and lots of luggage. Bed was very comfortable and no problem whatsoever with cleanliness. It's very quiet indeed - we weren't aware of any noise from other guests or cleaning for our whole stay. The staff were friendly in a detached, Parisian sort of way and always helpful. Recommended - it's a good deal for the price in central Paris. PS The restaurant of the Hotel du Degres Notre Dame opposite the cathedral does fantastic couscous and tagines - we ate there several times. Friendly staff and a very inquisitive cat too.

Reviews.Title: “awful experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before, great location, clean. This time though the room was unkempt, the sheets and pillow cases frayed, the bathroom disgusting, covered with a layer of someone else's black hair, the A/C did not work and it was warm and humid. My open window was on the bottom of a lightwell littered with cigarette butts. The hotel said they had no other room available and could do nothing to help my situation. I checked out immediately but the hotel still charged me $352.90 for my trouble. I would rather have slept on a park bench.

HotelInfo.Name: Bourgogne et Montana Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 3 rue de Bourgogne | 7th Arr., 75007 Paris, France
